Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >

Smart pointer implementation using reference counting. Dereferencing is as fast as it can get and might reach the speed of dereferencing raw pointers if a good optimizing compiler is used.

See Andrei Alexandrescu, Modern C++ Design, Addison-Wesley, 2002, pp. 165--167.

See http://Boost.org shared_ptr ( http://www.boost.org/libs/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.htm ).

Attention:
Beware of cycles of smart pointers as these will lead to memory leaks.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename T>
cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::shared_device_pointer (  )  [inline]

Constructs an empty shared_device_pointer. The use count is unspecified.

Postcondition:
get() == 0
Exceptions:
@c std::bad_alloc if memory could not be obtained.

template<typename T>
cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::shared_device_pointer ( shared_device_pointer< T > const &  other  )  [inline]

Constructs a shared_device_pointer that shares ownership with other.

Postcondition:
get() == other.get() and useCount() == other.useCount()
Exceptions:
Nothing. 

Definition at line 105 of file shared_device_pointer.h.

template<typename T>
template<typename U>
cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::shared_device_pointer ( shared_device_pointer< U > const &  other  )  [inline]

Constructs a shared_device_pointer that shares ownership with other. A pointer of type U must be assignable to a pointer of type T.

Postcondition:
get() == other.get() and useCount() == other.useCount()
Exceptions:
Nothing. 

Definition at line 119 of file shared_device_pointer.h.

template<typename T>
cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::~shared_device_pointer (  )  [inline]

Decreases the use count by one. If the use count hits 0 the managed pointer is deleted.

Exceptions:
Might throw an exception if the destructor of the managed pointer throws an exception if called.

Definition at line 130 of file shared_device_pointer.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T>
shared_device_pointer& cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::operator= ( shared_device_pointer< T >  other  )  [inline]

Shares the ownership of the pointer managed by other with other. The old managed pointer is deleted if ownership decreases to 0.

Exceptions:
Nothing.

template<typename T>
pointer cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::get (  )  const [inline]

Get direct control of the raw managed pointer.

Attention:
Don't delete the pointer behind the back of the smart pointer because this leads to undefined behavior.

Don't put the pointer under the management of this or another smart pointer!

Definition at line 168 of file shared_device_pointer.h.

template<typename T>
void cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::reset ( T *  _data = 0  )  [inline]

Sets a new pointer to be managed by the smart pointer.

Attention:
Don't add a pointer that is already managed by another smart pointer. Otherwise behavior is undefined.

Definition at line 178 of file shared_device_pointer.h.

template<typename T>
cupp::shared_device_pointer< T >::operator unspecified_bool_type (  )  const [inline]

Automatic cast operator to enable use of a smart pointer inside a conditional, for example to test if the smart pointer manages a 0 pointer.

See http://Boost.org shared_ptr ( http://www.boost.org/libs/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.htm ).

Calls static_cast for the pointer shared by sp while preserving the right use count.

Naming scheme resembles that of the Boost library.
